class.name: UndoRedo
class.brief_description: Helper to manage UndoRedo in the editor or custom tools.
class.description:
Helper to manage UndoRedo in the editor or custom tools. It works by registering methods and property changes inside 'actions'. Common behavior is to create an action, then add do/undo calls to functions or property changes, then committing the action. Here's an example on how to add an action to Godot editor's own 'undoredo': [codeblock] var undoredo = get_undo_redo() # method of EditorPlugin
func do_something(): pass # put your code here
func undo_something(): pass # put here the code that reverts what's done by "do_something()"
func _on_MyButton_pressed(): var node = get_node("MyNode2D") undoredo.create_action("Move the node") undoredo.add_do_method(self, "do_something") undoredo.add_undo_method(self, "undo_something") undoredo.add_do_property(node, "position", Vector2(100,100)) undoredo.add_undo_property(node, "position", node.position) undoredo.commit_action() [/codeblock] [method create_action], [method add_do_method], [method add_undo_method], [method add_do_property], [method add_undo_property], and [method commit_action] should be called one after the other, like in the example. Not doing so could lead to crashes. If you don't need to register a method you can leave [method add_do_method] and [method add_undo_method] out, and so it goes for properties. You can register more than one method/property.

method.name: add_do_method
method.description: Register a method that will be called when the action is committed.

method.name: add_do_property
method.description: Register a property value change for 'do'.

method.name: add_do_reference
method.description: Register a reference for 'do' that will be erased if the 'do' history is lost. This is useful mostly for new nodes created for the 'do' call. Do not use for resources.

method.name: add_undo_method
method.description: Register a method that will be called when the action is undone.

method.name: add_undo_property
method.description: Register a property value change for 'undo'.

method.name: add_undo_reference
method.description: Register a reference for 'undo' that will be erased if the 'undo' history is lost. This is useful mostly for nodes removed with the 'do' call (not the 'undo' call!).

method.name: clear_history
method.description: Clear the undo/redo history and associated references.

method.name: commit_action
method.description: Commit the action. All 'do' methods/properties are called/set when this function is called.

method.name: create_action
method.description: Create a new action. After this is called, do all your calls to [method add_do_method], [method add_undo_method], [method add_do_property], and [method add_undo_property], then commit the action with [method commit_action].

method.name: get_current_action_name
method.description: Get the name of the current action.

method.name: get_version
method.description: Get the version, each time a new action is committed, the version number of the UndoRedo is increased automatically. This is useful mostly to check if something changed from a saved version.
